sentences.sContent: A bird had been locked in and was by now quite frantic.
sentences.sCn: 一只鸟被关了起来，到现在它都非常狂躁。

sentences.sContent: ...many shoppers chose to avoid the frantic crowds and do their holiday shopping from the comfort of their computer...

remMethod.val: frant(看作front， 前线) ＋ ic(…的) → 听说被派往前线， 他很慌乱 → 慌乱不安的

trans.tranOther: extremely worried and frightened about a situation, so that you cannot control your feelings
